channel.title: A DAMN MOVIE PODCAST
channel.description: A theme based movie podcast that offers in depth reviews of films across the whole spectrum of film history from the silent era to modern day classics and new releases. Accompanied by our never ending film festivals, interviews and top 5's we will enthrall you with ridiculousness, knowledge and humor. We drink, we curse, and most reviews contain spoilers, so be weary. Voted Best New Podcast by SLC's City Weekly come be a fly on the wall of our conversations about the art form that we love with the ever so cultured and hilarious Adam Sherlock and Adam Palcher.
channel.itunes:author: Adam Palcher and Adam Sherlock

item.title: #163 - The Abyss / Monsters / Top 5 Special Effect Movies
item.description: We have no way of warning the surface. And you know what that means? It means, whatever happens, is up to the Adams.  This week, we revisit the 1989 underwater sci-fi hit The Abyss.  Along with that, we take a look at our third installment of the low budget festival with 2010's Monsters.  Then, it's our top 5 best special effects in a film.  Send us some feedback and give Sherlock a punishment review!

item.title: #162 - The Sixth Sense / Absentia / Top 5 Child Protagonists
item.description: We were supposed to draw a picture. Anything we wanted. I drew a man. He got hurt in the neck by another man with a screwdriver. Everyone got upset. They had a meeting. Mom started crying. I don't draw like that anymore.   I draw... people smiling, dogs running, podcasts. They don't have meetings about podcasts.  This week, the Adams see dead people, everywhere!  It all starts with the 1999 M. Night Shyamalan's The Sixth Sense.  Then we take a look at the second installment of our low budget film festival, Absentia.  To tie it all together, our top 5 child protagonists in a film.

item.title: #161 - Back To The Future / Primer / Top 5 Movie Vehicles
item.description: Last night, Darth Vader came down from Planet Vulcan and told me that if I didn't post this podcast, that he'd melt my brain. Thats right, kids.  It's time to take a look at a favorite of both of the Adams, Back To The Future.  As if that isn't enough time travel talk, lets melt our brains even more by delving into the first in our low budget film festival, the subtle and complicated time travel thriller, Primer.  Then, we get into our top 5 favorite vehicles from cinema.  Send in feedback and give Sherlock a punishment review film!

item.title: #160 - Midnight Cowboy / Mysterious Skin / Top 5 Breakout Actors Who Lost It
item.description: I like the way I look. Makes me feel good, it does. And women like me, dammit. Hell, the only one thing I ever been good for is podcastin'.  This week the Adam's spend a couple of cold nights out on the streets looking to hustle with two movies that show you why maybe being a gigalo isn't the best idea.  We start with 1969's Midnight Cowboy, and then move into the last installment of the Sherlock Should See This festival, Mysterious Skin.  To top it off, Top 5 Breakout Actors Who Lost It.

item.title: #159 - Drive / Martha Marcy May Marlene / Top 5 Anticipated Films For 2012
item.description: There's a hundred-thousand podcasts in this city. You give me a time and a place, I give you a two hour window. Anything happens in that two hours and I'm yours. No matter what. Anything happens a minute either side of that and you're on your own. Do you understand?  This week, we take a look at two newer releases, something that doesn't happen all that often on this show.  First, we review Ryan Gosling's stylish, violent thriller Drive, and then Elizabeth Olsen in the quietly paranoid drama Martha Marcy May Marlene.  We bring it all together with our Top anticipated movies for the rest of 2012.  Enjoy!

item.title: #158 - Superbad / Humpday / Top 5 Bromance Movies
item.description: I'm over here in my unit, isolated and alone, eating my terrible tasting food, and I have to look over at that. That looks like the most fun I've ever seen in my entire life, and it's B.S. - excuse my language. I'm just saying that I wash and dry; I'm like a single mother. Look, we all know podcasting is a joke - no offense - it's just that everyone takes this class to get an A, and it's bulls**t - and I'm sorry.  This week, we revisit the 2007 teen sex comedy Superbad.  We then get into our fourth installment of Sherlock should see this with the mumblecore comedy Humpday.  To tie it all together, our top 5 bromance movies.  Enjoy!

item.title: #157 - Do The Right Thing / 25th Hour / Top 5 New York Movies
item.description: Today's podcast is gonna rise up over 100 degrees, so theres a Jheri curl alert! That's right, Jheri curl alert. If you have a Jheri curl, stay in the house or you'll end up with a permanent black helmet on your head forever! This week, we take a look at the career of Spike Lee, one of the most powerful and provocative African-American directors of our time.  We start out with his critically acclaimed Do The Right Thing, and then move into the third installment of the Sherlock Should See This festival with The 25 th Hour.  We tie it all together with our top 5 New York movies.  Send Sherlock a punishment review!

item.title: #156 - Man On Wire / Touching The Void / Top 5 'Based On A True Story' Movies
item.description: I never doubted the Adam's talent...their prowess on the wire.  It was the unforseen things that really worried me.  You know, America's a very litigious society...you know, manslaughter, assisted suicide...I didn't want to be liable for the death of a podcaster.  This week, we take a look at James Marsh's award winning doc about the WTC and tightrope walkiing, Man On Wire.  Then, we get into the second installment of Sherlock Should See This, the mountainclimbing doc Touching The Void.  To tie it all together, we list our favorite 'based on a true story' films.  Send some more feedback!  Enjoy!

item.title: #155 - Midnight Express / Hunger / Top 5 Memorable Inmates
item.description: This ain't the good old USA!  This is A Damn Movie Podcast, man!  It's a f***ing accident here if you're innocent!  There ain't nobody here that is innocent!  This week, the Adams spend the whole episode talking prison movies, starting with the Alan Parker Turkish prison film, Midnight Express.  Then, they take a look at Steve R. McQueen's Irish film, Hunger.  They tie it all together with their top 5 most memorable inmates in a film.  Enjoy the show, and remember, donate 20 dollars and you get to send Sherlock a punishment review!

item.title: #154 - Jackie Brown / Coffy / Top 5 Actors That Deserve A Comeback
item.description: A Damn Movie Podcast, for when you absolutely, positively, need to get every motherf***er in the room to listen?  Accept no substitutes.  This week, we finish up our blaxploitation episode with Pam Grier's Coffy, and then take a look at her collaboration with Tarantino for the Elmore Leonard adaptation of Jackie Brown.  Finally, we tie it all together with our top 5 actors who deserve the comeback treatment.  Enjoy, and send a punishment review to Sherlock!

item.title: #153 - Stir of Echoes / JD's Revenge / Top 5 Dream Sequences
item.description: He can't stop it, he can't slow it down, he can't even figure it out. It's like he's in a tunnel with a flashlight. But the light only comes on every once in a while. He gets a glimpse of something, but not enough to know what it is. Just enough to know it's there.  Join the Adams this week as they do their 'DONT EVER GET HYPNOTIZED!' episode, where they look at the 1999 supernatural thriller, Stir of Echoes, and then the fourth installment of their blaxsploitation festival, JD's Revenge.  Then to round it out, top 5 dream sequences.  Be sure to donate and vote for a Sherlock Punishment Review!

item.title: #152 - Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy / Tops and Flops 2011
item.description: The Adams?  They are fanatics.  And a fanatic is always conceiling a secret doubt.  Welcome to our year end special, kids!  First we start out with the 2011 remake of the british esionage thriller Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy.  Then we dissect the films of the last year, with Palcher looking through his favorites and Sherlock complaining about things he barely understands.  Enjoy and lets hope there is less crap this coming year!

item.title: #151 - The Best Of Year Three
item.description: Here it is folks!  The best of year three.  More complaining about Star Wars, Sherlock making fun of Braveheart, Palcher gossiping about how Roger Waters likes his lasagna, and plenty of guests trying to get a word in edgewise.  Enjoy!

item.title: #150 - The Graduate / Top 5 Movies That Spoke To A Generation
item.description: I've got one word for you, kid.  Podcasts!  Welcome to our 150th episode!  This week we review the movie you guys voted for, The Graduate.  Then we get into a little bit of talk about our show, and try not to get too sappy.  We round things out with our top 5 movies that spoke to the generation that went to see them.  Thanks for downloading and send us feedback!

item.title: #149 - Its A Wonderful Life / Holiday Movie Cliches
item.description: Daddy, look! Every time a podcast is downloaded, an Adam gets his wings!  Ah yes.  This week we take a look at the holiday classic by Frank Capra and Jimmy Stewart, It's A Wonderful Life.  Suicide, drunken rage, squandered dreams and forclosure grief, it's the feelgood movie for the whole family.  Then we delve into the worst holiday movie cliches we could dredge up.  Light the log and spike the nog and get cosy!  Plus, send feedback!

item.title: #148 - Dirty Harry / Shaft / Top 5 Branded Characters
item.description: I know what you're thinking, is it episode 148 or 149?  Well, to tell you the truth, in all of this excitement, I kind of lost track myself.  But being as this is A Damn Movie Podcast, the most powerful podcast in the world that would blow your ears clean off, you gotta ask yourself, do you feel lucky?  This week, we look at two gritty action films from 1971, Dirty Harry and Shaft.  Along with an overview of Clint Eastwood's career, we do our top 5, Actors who have been associated with a role through their carreer.  Send us feedback and enjoy!

item.title: #147 - Blow / Superfly / Top 5 Last Job Movies
item.description: Sometimes you're flush and sometimes you're bust, and when you're up, it's never as good as you think it is, and when you're bust, you never think you'll be up again, but podcasting goes on.  This week we take a look at the 2001 Johnny Depp drug smuggling film, Blow.  Then it's time for our second installment of our blaxsploitation festival with Superfly.  We round things out with our Top 5 Last Job movies.  Send us feedback!

item.title: #146 - Hustle and Flow / The Mack / Top 5 Movies About Ambition
item.description: There are two types of people.  Those that talk the talk and those that walk the walk.  People who walk the walk sometimes talk the talk but most times they don't talk at all, 'cause they podcastin'.  This week, the Adams find out how hard it is out there for a pimp with the 2005 film Hustle and Flow.  We then begin our Blaxploitation festival with 1973's The Mack.  To tie it all together, we go with our top 5 movies about ambition.  Enjoy!

item.title: #145 - Poltergeist / Insidious
item.description: Happy Halloween everybody!  Join the Adam's this week when they are joined by Sherlock's lovely wife to review one of the best haunted house movies out there, Toby Hooper's 1982 Poltergeist.  Then, we take a look at this year's offering, James Wan's Insidious.  We also take a look at the some of the history of horror, and what it takes to scare us.  Hope you enjoy!

item.title: #144 - The Truman Show / We Live In Public / Top 5 Surveillance Films
item.description: While the world they inhabit is, in some respects, counterfeit, there's nothing fake about the Adams themselves.  No scripts, no cue cards.  It isn't always Shakespeare, but it's genuine.  It's a podcast.  This week we wrap up our Peter Weir festival with the 1998 groundbreaking The Truman Show.  Then we take a closer look at what 24 hour media coverage can do to a life in the documentary We Live In Public.  Then we rattle off our Top 5 Surveillance films.  Enjoy!

item.title: #143 - Into The Wild / The Mosquito Coast / Top 5 Movies Where Nature Is A Character
item.description: I'm going to paraphrase Thoreau here... rather than love, than money, than fame, than fairness.....give me a podcast.  Join the Adams as they take a journey through some of the best man vs. nature films out there.  We start with Sean Penn's 2007 Into The Wild, and then look at Peter Weir's The Mosquito Coast.  Then, top 5 movies where nature is a character. Music this week from the brand new Mark Dago cd, Kill Screen!  Enjoy!

item.title: #142 - Wonder Boys / Dead Poets Society / Top 5 Movies About Writers
item.description: She was a junkie for a good podcast.  Lucky for me, I manufactured her drug of choice.  This week we swoon over the quiet genius of Curtis Hanson's Wonder Boys.  Along with that is the third installment of our Peter Weir festival, Dead Poets Society.  Then it is all brought together when we look at our top 5 writers and movies about writing.  Almost two hours of gold here, folks.  Enjoy!

item.title: #141 - The Killing Fields / The Year Of Living Dangerously / Top 5 Reporters
item.description: They tell us God is dead. And now the Party, they call the uncle, will provide everything for us. The Enemy is inside us. No one can be trusted.  This week, we travel to the far side of the world for a look at foreign correspondants and the challenges they face on the job.  First is Roland Joffe's 1984 harrowing true story of Pol Pot's Cambodia, The Killing Fields. Then we take a look at our second installment of our Peter Weir festival, 1982's The Year Of Living Dangerously, starring a incredibly young Mel Gibson. Then, our top 5 movie reporters. With Palcher out of town last week, and Sherlock gone this week, we were able to just squeeze this one in! Send us some feedback and rate us on itunes.

item.title: #139 - This Is Spinal Tap / Anvil : The Story Of Anvil / Top 5 Soundtracks
item.description: But this podcast goes to 11!  This week we are joined by Andy Patterson for a serious heavy metal episode as we review the mother of all mockumentaries, This Is Spinal Tap!  Then, we delve into the hilarious and at times heartbreaking true story behind the best heavy metal band you've never heard of, Anvil - The Story Of Anvil.  To tie it all together, our top 5 soundtracks in a film.  Send us some feedback!

item.title: #138 - White Men Can't Jump / Hoop Dreams / Top 5 Movies That Aged Poorly
item.description: Sometimes when you win, you really lose, and sometimes when you lose, you really win.  And sometimes when you win or lose, you actually tie. And sometimes when you tie, you actually make a podcast about a stupid movie. This week, the boys are joined by Mr. Levi Lebo to review the 1992 Ron Shelton basketball comedy, White Men Can't Jump.  Along with the sports theme, we move into Steve James heartbreaking documentary, Hoop Dreams.  Then to tie it all together, we compare notes with our top 5 Movies That Aged Poorly.  Send us some feedback!

item.title: #137 - I Saw The Devil / Jee-woon Kim Interview
item.description: This week, join the Adams for a special review and interview segment of Jee-Woon Kim's 2010 South Korean revenge thriller, I Saw The Devil. First, Sherlock and Palcher delve into the plot and tone of the film itself, and then Palcher shares an exclusive interview with the director Jee-Woon Kim, as well as actor Byung-Hun Lee who plays the protagonist (sort of?) in the film.  Enjoy this short bonus episode, as the Adams have been taking time off from the podcast, busy making their own creepy serial killer film in the woods this week.  For reals!

item.title: #136 - Kids / The Devil's Playground / Top 5 24-Hour Movies
item.description: When you're young, not much matters.  When you find a podcast that you like, that's all you got.  Welcome to the corrupted youth episode! This week we spend a sweaty, dirty summer day in New York City with Larry Clark's KIDS.  Along with that, we delve into the riveting Amish documentary, The Devils Playground.  Then, our top 5 Movies That Occur In A Single Day.  Enjoy!  Send Us Feedback!

item.title: #135 - Planet Terror / Best Worst Movie / Top 5 Favorite Bad Movies
item.description: That boy's got the devil in him. This week the theme is the best of the worst as we "grind" out two reviews. Starting the show with Robert Rodriguez's 2007 multi-parody Planet Terror. For the festival we review the humbling Utah-based documentary about the underground cult of Troll 2 the one, the only Best Worst Movie, and predictably we give you our top 5 favorite worst movies. It's a good'un folks! Thanks for listening and like us on Facebook!

item.title: #134 - Exit Through The Gift Shop / F For Fake / Top 5 Movies That Question Art
item.description: The story of how an eccentric French shop keeper and amateur film maker attempted to locate and befriend Banksy gets hashed to bit as we review 2010's Exit Through The Gift Shop. We also begin our documentary fest with Orsen Welles glorious performance in his essay documentary from 1973 F For Fake. Then to continue the theme we give you are top 5 films that question or challenge art. Boo ya.

item.title: #133 - Amores Perros / A Zed And Two Noughts / Top 5 Car Crashes
item.description: Love is betrayal. Love is anguish. Love is sin. Love is selfish. Love is hope. Love is pain. Love is death. What is love? Love's a bitch. This week we delved deep into the multi themed and layered Amores Perros from Mexican director Alejandro González Iñárritu. We match it up with Sherlock's last time of giving it to Palcher as he offers up one of the strangest films in the fest yet Peter Greenway's A Zed And Two Noughts. With car crashes being major theme in both films we give you our top 5 movie car crashes. please donate!

item.title: #130 - Persepolis / The Triplets Of Belleville / Top 5 Rebels

item.title: #129 - World's Greatest Dad / The Loved One / Top 5 Obnoxious Kids
item.description: I used to think the worst thing in life was to end up all alone. It's not. The worst thing in life is ending up with people who make you feel all alone. This week we review highly underrated Bobcat Goldthwait film World's Greatest Dad, then we start 'Giving It To Palcher' with Sherlock's first choice of 1965's The Loved One. Then we come full circle with our top 5 obnoxious kids in movies. Please donate! We love you!

item.title: #127 - Forrest Gump / Susanne Bier Interview / Top 5 Oscar Upsets
item.description: Momma always said that you should listen to A Damn Movie Podcast. In anticipation of the Oscars this week we delay our last listener feedback episode and give an Oscar filled good time as we review the 1994 Robert Zemeckis Oscar winner the classic dummy-tale Forrest Gump.  And fresh off her win for Best Foreign Picture for In A Better World you can listen to my interview with the one the only Ms. Susanne Bier (After The Wedding, Brothers, Open Hearts) from this years Sundance festival. Then we round it out with our Top 5 Oscar Upsets over the last 83 years. Enjoy, please donate!

item.title: #126 - Shakespeare In Love / Much Ado About Nothing / Top 5 Shakespeare Interpretations
item.description: Fifty Pounds!  A very worthy sum on a very worthy question.  Can a podcast show us the very truth and nature of love? This week the Adams finally tackle the dense language and dizzy romance of Mr.  William Shakespeare.  We start with the 1997 Academy Award winner Shakespeare In Love, and then talk about Kenneth Branagh's Much Ado About Nothing. Then, our top 5 Shakespeare Interpretations.  Enjoy!

item.title: #121 - Near Dark / Top 5 Female Directors

item.title: #117 - The Orphanage / The Devil's Backbone / Top 5 Ghosts in Cinema
item.description: Happy Halloween Everybody!  This week, the Adams focus in on Guillermo Del Toro's twisted imagination with two spanish language horror films.  First, we take a look at juan Antonio Bayona's 2007 gothic tale of dread, The Orphanage.  Then, we look back at Guillermo's own civil war ghost story of innocence lost, The Devil's Backbone.  Finally we top of this spooky episode with our top 5 most infamous ghosts in cinema.  Have a safe and happy Halloween, and send us some feedback!

item.title: #107 - Inception / SLC Film Festival
item.description: You are waiting for a podcast.  A podcast that will take you far away.  You know where you hope this podcast will take you, but you can't be sure.  Yet it doesn't matter, because we will be together.  In this special episode of A Damn Movie Podcast, the boys try to sift throught the layers and layers of subconscious to the truth that is Christopher Nolan's new science fiction head-scratcher, INCEPTION.  There is a both non-spoiler and spoiler section, so there is a little something for everyone.  Also, an interview with Trevor Hale, from the Salt Lake City Film Festival.  Music by Callow.  Send us feedback!

item.title: Sundance Interview : Get Low Interview (Lucas Black, Dir. Aaron Schneider)
item.description: A story about an old man who has a bad reputation in a small town in Alabama wants to throw himself a funeral party as the basis for the Sundance flick Get Low. Starring Robert Duvall, Bill Murray, Sissy Spacek, and Lucas Black. Unfortunately all the "big" stars bailed the roundtable interview, but I got a chance to sit down with actor Lucas Black and director Aaron Schneider. Enjoy!

item.title: Sundance Interview : Jeff Goldsmith
item.description: I was lucky enough to sit down and have a great conversation with Senior Editor and fellow podcaster Jeff Goldsmith about his magazine Creative Screenwriting and his screening series where he has Q&A's with he best of the best. We discuss Sundance, their Screenwriting Expo, the state of indie film and how to tell a good story. If you enjoy this interview I highly recommend his podcast, one of my favorites. Thanks again Jeff!

To finish out the show we give you our Top 5 Multiple Role Movies and the long forgotten and much promised feedback section. Send us more! Music by Shark Speed and Blue Sunshine Soul.
